page.title: 09Ecology: Climate, Footpaths
page.content:
Climate and Weather
The climate is marked by continental features - extremes of temperature and a low annual rainfall of 21" which falls all year, although a summer maximum is associated with thunderstorms. February is the driest month, July the wettest. Prevailing winds are south-westerly.
Footpaths
Footpaths run along the banks of Swaffham lode and the River; the very few that cross arable fields are unmarked and ploughed over. Some are signposted and the Parish Council keeps a record of them all.
